intro: Centaurium chilense var. paposanum, commonly known as the Chilean centaury, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Chile. It belongs to the family Gentianaceae and is characterized by its small, tubular flowers that typically range in color from yellow to orange. The plant has hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves, and it thrives in moist, mountainous environments. It is often found in high-altitude regions and is adapted to cool, temperate climates. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens.
